content.description: This is a sweet finger crack that begs to be longer. Start on the ledge and climb the crack nearly to the top where it becomes a bit blank before reaching the anchors.<iframe width="958" height="539" src="youtube.com/embed/pJCzIUHusâ€¦; frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
content.location: PE is one of the first climbs on the main wall.  Look left for the phenomenal but short finger crack.  Bolt anchors at the top.

content.description: This is a sport route that protects more safely with a piece or two of .5 pro.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors shared with Jengo Fett.
content.location: Second bolted route as you enter the main climbing area. Look for the short, broken left facing flake.

content.description: First bolted climb that you come to at this wall. Rating is provisional; may be much easier once all the lichen is cleaned off. Move up through face to the left facing arete.   Submitted by: brake on 2006-10-18
content.location: first bolted route on the main wall
Follow the same trad start at the right facing corner.  Once you reach the ledge, follow straight up, clipping 3 bolts.

content.description: Climb the right facing corner to the ledge. Traverse left about 8 feet to join the regular route.
content.protection: Nuts to a #2.  Pro is a bit tricky down low.

content.description: This is a decent lead for a solid 5.6 climber.  The pro thins out halfway up and under the roof, which is the crux.
content.protection: Nuts to a #2BD.  Build a belay at a small tree at the top. Rap off the anchors to the left or the right.
content.location: This route is the broken left facing flake/corner.

content.description: Climb the broken face just to the left of Premature Ecrackulation.  Interesting variety of moves...some variations possible.  A long 48" sling is helpful for the top to traverse to the PE anchors.
content.protection: Typical trad rack to 2"; rap off the anchors on Premature Ecrackulation.

content.description: Left of Bird Shit Overhang. Clip 2 bolts on the thin, technical face as you climb to the ledge...definitely the crux. Place gear at lip of the roof and pull it (5.9+).  You'll find another bolt just over the roof where you need it. Climb the easy off-width crack to anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus gear for roof (nothing larger than a .75 C4)
content.location: Left of Bird Shit Overhang, right of Gunkness Right Direct.

content.description: Nice bolted route that goes over the roof.
content.protection: 5-6 bolts to anchors. Route protects nicely in the mid-section with pro.
content.location: Starts to the right of AARP and to the left of Gunkness, which is the left facing corner.

content.description: Clip the first two bolts to the roof, plug pro in the roof, and then pull up through it.  Finish on a bolt or two.
content.location: Find the obvious roof with white non-chaulk-like stuff running beneath it.

content.description: This is the main area at IGR that features ten or so climbs.
